title: In Brittany, the far right targets drag culture
description: Two drag readings for young audiences have been violently interrupted by far-right activists since the beginning of the year in the French region. Local artists are refusing to give in to fear.

title: US soccer star Megan Rapinoe announces she’ll retire after the NWSL season
description: Rapinoe, 38, announced Saturday her fourth World Cup will be her last and she'll officially retire with the OL Reign at the end of the National Women's Soccer League season.

title: Photographer Matika Wilbur restores memory and pride to Native Americans
description: Matika Wilbur, of the Swimomish and Tulalip tribes, hit the road in 2012 to photograph and interview members of hundreds of tribal nations across the United States. A book documenting her journey has just been published.

title: Sharks and turtles now have legal rights in the Loyalty Islands region of New Caledonia
description: The province, which has extensive autonomy in terms of environmental standards, recognizes these animals as subjects of law.

title: The United States after affirmative action
description: Introduced to address racial inequalities, this form of preference for university admission was overturned on June 29 by the Supreme Court. Le Monde brought together two American intellectuals with opposing views on this crucial issue.

title: Syria: NGO brings proof the Shabiha were killers in the pockets of the Assad regime
description: Official documents published by an NGO provide the hitherto missing proof that these militiamen, perpetrators of countless crimes, were deployed on the initiative of the Damascus authorities.

title: British star cyclist Mark Cavendish crashes out of Tour de France
description: Cavendish hit the ground while riding at the back of the peloton at moderate speed on Saturday. He entered an ambulance holding his right shoulder in pain before his retirement was announced.

title: Were Adam and Eve vegetarians?
description: Science history professor Stéphane Van Damme takes a look at the current – but long-standing – debate on the evolution of meat consumption in human societies.

title: Russia says US cluster bombs for Ukraine show 'weakness'
description: The United States announced Friday it will provide the controversial munitions to Ukraine, a move that drew sharp criticism from rights groups due to the danger unexploded bomblets pose.

title: Inside Kremenchuk, the small town where Russia's war has strengthened Ukrainian patriotism
description: The attack on the working-class town's shopping center on June 27, left a lasting impression. The city is now renaming its streets after Ukrainian soldiers who died on the front line.

title: Protesters rally against police violence in several French cities
description: Two memorial rallies for Adama Traroé, a young Black man who died in police custody seven years ago, were banned by the authorities for fear of reigniting the recent unrest.

title: Mexican child support dodgers are publicly called out
description: Seven out of 10 separated fathers in the country fail to pay their ex-spouses for their children's upbringing. Advocacy groups have just obtained the creation of a national register to limit the rights of those who don't pay.

title: Zelensky hails 'brave' Ukraine on 500th day of war
description: The Ukrainian president said Ukraine was the 'country of the brave' on Saturday in a video showing him on Snake Island in the Black Sea. Ukrainians remain united in the effort to repel Russian forces but their resilience is constantly being tested.

title: In vitro fertilization: 'Possible health risks for children are insufficiently documented in France'
description: Professor Pierre Jouannet, a member of the French Academy of Medicine, alerts on the lack of medical data on this population.

title: Macron and the banlieues: A series of missed opportunities
description: In 2017, as a candidate for the presidency, Emmanuel Macron raised hopes in the poorer neighborhoods of France's cities. But he has often made surprise policy changes that have built distrust.

title: In Canada, the land of 'happy immigration,' Quebec is an exception
description: The country relies heavily on labor immigration, with many of the workers coming from Southeast Asia, who settle in English-speaking provinces. French-speaking Quebec fears that its influence at the federal level will be diminished, and that its 'interculturalist' model will be jeopardized.

title: 3 arrested in India after train crash that left more than 290 dead
description: The three men are two signal engineers and one technician. They have been charged with culpable homicide without murder and destruction of evidence.

title: US destroys its last declared chemical weapons, watchdog hails milestone
description: The United States was the last country in the world to possess 'declared' stockpiles of chemical weapons, although some states are believed to maintain secret reserves.

title: Zelensky wins Erdogan's NATO backing after securing US cluster bombs
description: Washington has given its green light for the delivery of the controversial bombs, which are banned in many countries and can pose a significant threat to civilians.
